item.title: The Plains Cupid
item.description: ![[Above.jpg]] Subject - The Plains Cupid (Luthrodes pandava) Long afternoon walks are the best thing to happen to raccoon-eyed college students who have taken to living in the library. Especially if you are intercepted by these pretty sights; they flit about in the bushes, and dance nimbly on the slender stalks of coatbuttons, and overall, make a torrid summer more bearable. ![[IMG_20230622_224325 (1).jpg|500]] A male wet season brood These butterflies belong to the Lycaenidae family (tribe Polyommatini) of butterflies, (the second-largest family of butterflies behind Nymphalidae, or the brush footed butterflies), whose members are called gossamer-winged butterflies.
